event.title: the time of the Domesday Book of 1086

data.event: Known as Weolingtun in the Anglo-Saxon period, its name had changed to Walintone by the time of the Domesday Book of 1086.

event.title: became a town under a royal charter of 1215

data.event: Wellington became a town under a royal charter of 1215 and during the Middle Ages it grew as a centre for trade on the road from Bristol to Exeter.

event.title: a fire in the town in 1731

data.event: Major rebuilding took place following a fire in the town in 1731, after which it became a centre for cloth-making.
The Grand Western Canal reached the town in 1835 and then the Bristol and Exeter Railway in 1843.
The town's own railway station survived until 1964.
